root.name: & (bitwise AND)

example.code: int a = 207; // In binary: 11001111 int b = 61; // In binary: 00111101 int c = a & b; // In binary: 00001101 println(c); // Prints "13", the decimal equivalent to 00001101

root.description:
Compares each corresponding bit in the binary representation of the values. For each comparison two 1's yeild 1, 1 and 0 yeild 0, and two 0's yeild 0. This is easy to see when we look at the binary representation of numbers 
  11010110  // 214
& 01011100  // 92
  --------
  01010100  // 84
To see the binary representation of a number, use the binary() function with println().
